result.execSummary:
All charges against Allen Edward Borek Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allen Edward Borek Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allen Edward Borek in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.26.22

Defendant Allen Edward Borek in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 7-27-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant Allen Edward Borek in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Allen Edward Borek in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Allen Edward Borek appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Case retabbed due to intake judge of week.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
